fields.body:
On Wednesday November 24 Queen Beatrix will open the new faculty building. All staff and students in the building have received an invitation via e-mail.
For this festive event to run smoothly there are a few rules that staff and students must adhere.

* No pictures of the Queen, not even with a mobile phone. All afternoon photos will be taken by a house photographer. These will be freely available at the website of the UvA.
* Do not call or otherwise attract the attention of the Queen.
* Do not offer gifts to the Queen.
When everyone observes these rules, the opening will take place in a pleasant atmosphere.

For more information about the opening on November 24, please contact the Communication Department of the Faculty of Science: 020-525 7865 or info-science@uva.nl.
fields.title: Visit Queen Beatrix to the Faculty of Science
fields.body_html:
On Wednesday November 24 Queen Beatrix will open the new faculty building. All staff and students in the building have received an invitation via e-mail. For this festive event to run smoothly there are a few rules that staff and students must adhere.

  • No pictures of the Queen, not even with a mobile phone. All afternoon photos will be taken by a house photographer. These will be freely available at the website of the UvA.
  • Do not call or otherwise attract the attention of the Queen.
  • Do not offer gifts to the Queen. When everyone observes these rules, the opening will take place in a pleasant atmosphere.

For more information about the opening on November 24, please contact the Communication Department of the Faculty of Science: 020-525 7865 or info-science@uva.nl.

fields.body:
Viva Fysica 2011
Vrijdag 28 januari 2011, 9:00 - 16:30 uur

De afdeling Natuur- en sterrenkunde van de Universiteit van Amsterdam organiseert het congres Viva Fysica! voor docenten natuurkunde en andere belangstellenden met interesse in de actuele ontwikkelingen in het (astro)fysisch onderzoek.

Tijdens deze tiende editie komen onderwerpen aan bod die verschillende grenze van onze kennis over de natuur en het heelal verkennen.
Het ochtendprogramma bestaat uit een reeks lezingen door toonaangevende onderzoekers. 's Middags kunt u deelnemen aan verschillende rondleidingen en workshops, zowel in het nieuwe gebouw van de faculteit als bij het Nationaal Instituut voor subatomaire fysica (Nikhef). Neem bijvoorbeeld een kijkje in de sterrenkoepel en het mobiele planetarium of bezoek een laboratorium. In de workshops worden diverse experimenten uitgevoerd en toegelicht, zoals het Davisson-Germer experiment of het zichtbaar maken van kosmische straling.

Locatie:
Science Park Amsterdam
Science Park 904
1098 XH  Amsterdam
fields.title: Viva Fysica 2011
fields.body_html:
Viva Fysica 2011 Vrijdag 28 januari 2011, 9:00 - 16:30 uur

De afdeling Natuur- en sterrenkunde van de Universiteit van Amsterdam organiseert het congres Viva Fysica! voor docenten natuurkunde en andere belangstellenden met interesse in de actuele ontwikkelingen in het (astro)fysisch onderzoek.

Tijdens deze tiende editie komen onderwerpen aan bod die verschillende grenze van onze kennis over de natuur en het heelal verkennen. Het ochtendprogramma bestaat uit een reeks lezingen door toonaangevende onderzoekers. 's Middags kunt u deelnemen aan verschillende rondleidingen en workshops, zowel in het nieuwe gebouw van de faculteit als bij het Nationaal Instituut voor subatomaire fysica (Nikhef). Neem bijvoorbeeld een kijkje in de sterrenkoepel en het mobiele planetarium of bezoek een laboratorium. In de workshops worden diverse experimenten uitgevoerd en toegelicht, zoals het Davisson-Germer experiment of het zichtbaar maken van kosmische straling.

Locatie: Science Park Amsterdam Science Park 904 1098 XH Amsterdam

fields.body:
Dear all,

The next NOVA Fall School for (beginning) PhD students will take place in Dwingeloo from October 3-7. The lecturers this year, will be Anna Watts
(Amsterdam), on The Physics of Neutron Stars, and Saleem Zaroubi (Groningen) on The Epoch of Reionization. I would like to ask the responsible people of each institute, as well as the supervisors, to let their beginning PhD students know that they should keep that week in October free for
participation in the school.

All the necessary information will be available from August at this [website](http://www.astro.rug.nl/~novaeduc/). 
Registration will be open around the middle of August.

If you have questions about the school, don't hesitate in asking [Reynier Peletier](mailto:peletier@astro.rug.nl).
fields.title: NOVA Fall School
fields.body_html:
Dear all,

The next NOVA Fall School for (beginning) PhD students will take place in Dwingeloo from October 3-7. The lecturers this year, will be Anna Watts (Amsterdam), on The Physics of Neutron Stars, and Saleem Zaroubi (Groningen) on The Epoch of Reionization. I would like to ask the responsible people of each institute, as well as the supervisors, to let their beginning PhD students know that they should keep that week in October free for participation in the school.

All the necessary information will be available from August at this website. Registration will be open around the middle of August.

If you have questions about the school, don't hesitate in asking Reynier Peletier.

fields.body:
LOFT, the Large Observatory For X-ray Timing, is a newly proposed space mission that will answer fundamental questions about the motion of matter orbiting close to the event horizon of a black hole, and the state of matter in neutron stars.  LOFT was recently selected by ESA as one of the four M3 mission candidates that will compete for a launch opportunity at the start of the 2020s. 
 
During this assessment phase we need to make a full study of the exciting science that could be done with such a telescope, and solidify the relationship between the science goals and the technical requirements. 
 
To do this, and to solicit full involvement from the wider astronomical community in this opportunity, there will be a LOFT Science meeting on October 26-28 this year at the Science Park in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
fields.title: LOFT Science Meeting
fields.body_html:
LOFT, the Large Observatory For X-ray Timing, is a newly proposed space mission that will answer fundamental questions about the motion of matter orbiting close to the event horizon of a black hole, and the state of matter in neutron stars. LOFT was recently selected by ESA as one of the four M3 mission candidates that will compete for a launch opportunity at the start of the 2020s.

During this assessment phase we need to make a full study of the exciting science that could be done with such a telescope, and solidify the relationship between the science goals and the technical requirements.

To do this, and to solicit full involvement from the wider astronomical community in this opportunity, there will be a LOFT Science meeting on October 26-28 this year at the Science Park in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

fields.body:
## Scientific meeting (in English) in the "Booth Hall", Utrecht University Library

* 09:30 - 10:15   Welcome with coffee and tea
* 10:15 - 10:20   Opening by the chairman of the NAC
* 10:20 - 11:00   Dr. Michael Wise (ASTRON): "Next Generation Radio Astronomy with LOFAR"
* 11:00 - 11:40   Dr. Stephanie Cazaux (U. Groningen): "The memories of interstellar ices: deuterium as a witness of star formation"
* 11:40 - 12:20   Dr. Elmar Körding (U. Nijmegen) "Jets and accreting flows on all scales"
* 12:20 - 13:00   Huishoudelijke Vergadering NAC/ Business meeting (in Dutch)
* 13:00 - 14:00   Lunch
* 14:00 - 14:40   Dr. Elena Rossi (U. Leiden): "Consequences of tidal interactions close to a compact object"
* 14:40 - 16:10   Special session: Netherlands Committee Astronomy (NCA) "Strategic Plan 2011-2020"
* 14:40 - 15:10   Prof.dr. Ralph Wijers (NCA Chair): "Presentation Strategic Plan 2011-2020"
* 15:10 - 16:10   Discussion regarding priorities laid out in Strategic Plan.
* 16:10 - 16:15   Closing by the chairman of the NAC
* 16:15 - 17:00   Reception

fields.body:
From 15:00 to 17:00, the Board of the University will visit GRAPPA
for a meeting as part of its initial evaluation. You are all most welcome to 
attend the welcome and presentations, which take place between 15:00 and 16:00 in C4.174.

Especially the staff and students associated with GRAPPA are encouraged to try very hard to
be there.

* 15:00 - reception in SP.C4.174
* 15:10 - opening and introduction by prof. dr. Ralph Wijers
* 15:25 - presentation dr. Shin'ichiro Ando (new staff GRAPPA)
* 15:40 - presentation dr. Patrick Decowski (new staff GRAPPA)
* 15:55 - general questions and discussion
* 16:00 - tour GRAPPA-location Science Park (incl. domes API)
* 16:25 - tour GRAPPA-locatie Nikhef
* 17:00 - reception at Nikhef
* 17:30 - finish
fields.title: University board GRAPPA visit
fields.body_html:
From 15:00 to 17:00, the Board of the University will visit GRAPPA for a meeting as part of its initial evaluation. You are all most welcome to attend the welcome and presentations, which take place between 15:00 and 16:00 in C4.174.

Especially the staff and students associated with GRAPPA are encouraged to try very hard to be there.

  • 15:00 - reception in SP.C4.174
  • 15:10 - opening and introduction by prof. dr. Ralph Wijers
  • 15:25 - presentation dr. Shin'ichiro Ando (new staff GRAPPA)
  • 15:40 - presentation dr. Patrick Decowski (new staff GRAPPA)
  • 15:55 - general questions and discussion
  • 16:00 - tour GRAPPA-location Science Park (incl. domes API)
  • 16:25 - tour GRAPPA-locatie Nikhef

  • 17:30 - finish
